licence_overview:
$!Register with the Health and Social Care Regulation and Quality Improvement Authority (RQIA) if you run an adult placement service in Northern Ireland.$!

If you operate or manage more than one service, you must make a separate application for each.

##Conditions
As part of your registration with RQIA, you must complete an AccessNI enhanced disclosure form. AccessNI supply criminal history information on people who want to work with vulnerable adults.

The [enhanced disclosure form and guidance](http://www.rqia.org.uk/what_we_do/registration__inspection_and_reviews/registration_with_rqia.cfm "AccessNI Enhanced Disclosure form and guidance"){:rel="external"} are available from the RQIA website. 

There is a separate fee of £30 for for completing the enhanced disclosure. 
  
##How to apply
[Application forms and guidance](http://www.rqia.org.uk/what_we_do/registration__inspection_and_reviews/registration_with_rqia.cfm "Application forms and guidance"){:rel="external"} are available on the RQIA website. You can also call or email the Registration Team for information. 

$C
**RQIA Registration Team**  
<registration@rqia.org.uk>  
(028) 9051 7500
$C

##Fees

The is no fee for registering with the RQIA, other than the £30 for the enhanced disclosure.

*[RQIA]: Health and Social Care Regulation and Quality Improvement Authority
